title: Practice Exercise
description:
Build a **Data Analyzer** that processes a list of monthly sales figures using slicing. **Requirements:** - Create a list of 12 monthly sales values (Jan-Dec) - Extract and analyze:
  • Q1 (first 3 months) - Q2 (months 3-6) - Q3 (months 6-9) - Q4 (last 3 months) - First half (Jan-Jun) - Second half (Jul-Dec)
    • - Calculate average for each quarter - Find which quarter had highest average - Get alternating months (Jan, Mar, May, etc.) - Reverse the year's data - Show top 3 and bottom 3 months **Example Output:** 
    === Sales Data Analyzer ===

Monthly Sales: [45000, 48000, 52000, 55000, 58000, 61000, 59000, 57000, 54000, 56000, 60000, 65000]

Quarterly Analysis:
Q1 (Jan-Mar): [45000, 48000, 52000]
  Average: $48,333.33

Q2 (Apr-Jun): [55000, 58000, 61000]
  Average: $58,000.00

Q3 (Jul-Sep): [59000, 57000, 54000]
  Average: $56,666.67

Q4 (Oct-Dec): [56000, 60000, 65000]
  Average: $60,333.33

Best Quarter: Q4 with average of $60,333.33

Half-Year Analysis:
First Half (Jan-Jun): Average $53,166.67
Second Half (Jul-Dec): Average $58,500.00

Alternating Months: [45000, 52000, 58000, 59000, 54000, 60000]

Reversed Data: [65000, 60000, 56000, 54000, 57000, 59000, 61000, 58000, 55000, 52000, 48000, 45000]

Top 3 Months: [65000, 61000, 60000]
Bottom 3 Months: [45000, 48000, 52000]

hints.text: For Q1 use [:3], Q2 use [3:6], Q3 use [6:9], Q4 use [-3:] or [9:]. First half is [:6], second half is [6:] or [-6:]. Alternating is [::2]. Reverse is [::-1]. Top 3 from sorted: [-3:], bottom 3: [:3]. Remember: stop index is NOT included!

commonMistakes.correction: Add : at the end of the line
